sentence.Network_en: There's a zoo round here? That's dandy for my kids.

sentence.Network_en: I know him to be nothing but a man of pleasure, a dandy who has given himself up to the relentless pursuit of sensual pleasure.
sentence.Network_cn: 我知道他是一个放荡的人, 一个不顾一切、死心塌地地追求情欲之欢的花花公子.

sentence.Network_en: He was handsome and a dandy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他英俊潇洒，还是个衣着讲究的时髦绅士。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: perhaps a shortened form of 17th-cent. Jack-a-dandy 'conceited fellow' (the last element representing Dandy, a pet form of the given name Andrew)

entry.tran: 时髦男子;注重打扮的男人
entry.def: A dandy is a man who thinks a great deal about his appearance and always dresses in smart clothes.

example.ex: He was handsome and a dandy.
example.tran: 他英俊潇洒，还是个衣着讲究的时髦绅士。

entry.def: If you say that something is dandy, you mean it is good or just right.

example.ex: There's a zoo round here? That's dandy for my kids.
example.tran: 这附近有个动物园？我的孩子们一定会很高兴的。

means.word_mean: 1. a man who is much concerned with his dress and appearance

sentences.sentence: "had a great time at the party"
